pullRequest.title: Issue 5072: Single routing key batch writes
pullRequest.bodyText:
Signed-off-by: Shivesh Ranjan shivesh.ranjan@gmail.com
Change log description
Implementation for writing batch events using append block protocol.
Purpose of the change
Fixes #5072
What the code does
Updates the PendingEvent object to also be a composite object of a batch of events apart from supporting single event.
SegmentOutputStreamImpl uses this pending event which can have more than one event and advances the event sequence number based on the number of events.
How to verify it
Unit tests added

commit.message:
revert unchanged files

Signed-off-by: Shivesh Ranjan <shivesh.ranjan@gmail.com>

example for writer batch api

Signed-off-by: Shivesh Ranjan <shivesh.ranjan@gmail.com>
Merge branch 'lwt' of https://github.com/shiveshr/pravega-1 into lwt

size limit moved to pending event

Signed-off-by: Shivesh Ranjan <shivesh.ranjan@gmail.com>
Merge branch 'lwt' of https://github.com/shiveshr/pravega-1 into lwt

nodes.bodyText: I do not see how there can be multiple PendingEvents here. Am I missing something here?

Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
                 * collective batch should be twice of {@link Serializer#MAX_EVENT_SIZE}. 
          
          
            
                 * collective batch should less than twice the {@link Serializer#MAX_EVENT_SIZE}.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -60,7 +61,29 @@
      *         exponential backoff. So there is no need to attempt to retry in the event of an exception.
      */
     CompletableFuture<Void> writeEvent(String routingKey, Type event);
-    
+
+    /**
+     * Write an ordered list of events to the stream atomically for a given routing key. 
+     * Events written with the same routing key will be read by readers in exactly the same order they were written. 
+     * The maximum size of the serialized event individually should be {@link Serializer#MAX_EVENT_SIZE} and the 
+     * collective batch should be twice of {@link Serializer#MAX_EVENT_SIZE}.

nodes.bodyText: Do we need a new method here? Or should the beginTxn on TransactionalWriter take an optional routing key?
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -85,6 +86,18 @@ static EventStreamClientFactory withScope(String scope, ClientConfig config) {
      */
     <T> EventStreamWriter<T> createEventWriter(String writerId, String streamName, Serializer<T> s, EventWriterConfig config);
     
+    /**
+     * Creates a new single routing key transaction writer that can write a batch of events with atomic guarantees. 
+     * There are limits on the size of each event in the batch and the overall size of the batch.
+     *
+     * @param streamName The name of the stream to write to.
+     * @param routingKey Routing key to be used while writing the events.
+     * @param s The Serializer.
+     * @param <T> The type of events.
+     * @return Newly created writer object
+     */
+    <T> SingleRoutingKeyTransactionWriter<T> createSingleRoutingKeyWriter(String streamName, String routingKey, Serializer<T> s);

nodes.bodyText: Rather than making an N level deep structure, it would be better to add all the buffers into a list and then create a single wrapping buffer.
